ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] bah numbers
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Actually, Accelerando will slow down to non-drum speed whenver you lose a buff, gain a buff, or zone.  I think these events cause a reappraisal of what
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 28 Mar 2000 jhenders@... wrote:
> On Tue, Mar 28/00, kim@... wrote:
> >
> > Some effects (like Accelerando) are client side, so aren't
> > affected by this.
>
> You are probably right about them getting out of sync but I've even seen
> it happen with Selo's. I've had the fading of the SoW icon actually slow
> me down while playing Selo's. I think it was back when Selo's would
> override SoW but the icon stayed up. When the icon for SoW faded I
> actually slowed down until the next Selo's pulse, dispite the fact that
> SoW had been overridden.

Actually, Accelerando will slow down to non-drum speed whenver
you lose a buff, gain a buff, or zone. I think these events
cause a reappraisal of what buffs you currently have on, and
the spdata.eff file lists song effects without instruments.
So when your buffs are reappraised, the song effects get set
back to non-instrument values (need to test this with a buff
song).

It's usually not a problem because our songs refresh so
quickly. It's annoying enough that I /bugged it a long time
ago though.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
